title: How comes "playmaker" champs always end up being annoying/hated?
body:
Champions like {{champion:67}}, {{champion:157}}, {{champion:64}}, {{champion:164}}, and {{champion:92}} always seem to be hated by most of the community (even when not discussing the people who main them...) They tend to feel annoying and unfun to have to fight. What exactly do these characters have that makes them so annoying and hated? Is it their mobility, damage, outplay potential, CC, or just having a toxic kit for the game? What makes y'all annoyed by these champs? For me it's just how much they have to offer, or being overloaded. It's easy to make a champion sound OP or overloaded, but look at what these champs tend to have.

* Mobility (Situational or not)
* Damage (In the form of either burst or DPS)
* Some sort of HARD crowd control (stuns, knockups, displacements, etc.)
* Useful in teamfights (Asides from probably Camille, who's a bit more duelist-oriented)

The real question is what truly makes these champions so unliked and hated, and what can be done to fix it besides QQing about "nerf/delete so-and-so" or Riot (sometimes) taking sides on champions? (I won't bother quoting what they said about Lee Sin cause it does make sense: have a flashy champion make money, it's business. They _said_ they're going to nerf him if he becomes overbearing, and we have seen that happen.)

replies.body:
Personally, I tend to have three main issues with such champions.

1) They have the tools to dictate how a fight occurs, so their deaths are usually due to them screwing up rather than you out-playing them.  

2) They tend to attract toxic players (due to their nature as duelists focused on 'outplaying' opponents) at far higher frequency than most champions; they tend to be appealing to players focusing on personal performance and KD rather than cooperation/strategy.  

These players are frequently prone to harassment, AFKing, tilting and feeding which ruins the game for their allies and enemies alike; if a player picks the champion, everyone is just waiting to see if they are toxic.

3) The champions tend to be feast-or-famine; they will either get fed or feed horribly.  Games will often be decided based on the champion's performance since they can single-handedly win or lose a game based on their performance.
------------------
While I'm not going to say that such champions aren't balanced, I dislike having them in the game for either team.  I find that they tend to ruin the experience far more often than most champions.

As the {{champion:92}} main and a fighting game player first and foremost, I stand in the party that wishes more champions were like these playmakers, tbh. I'd rather not win or lose purely based on a stat check like most other champions do. I want to be able to pour some serious practice hours into Riven like I would with any fighting game character I would learn how to play and just get better at playing her, and I would very much like everyone else to do the same for all their characters. I never really liked simple characters unless I'm dead tired or just being lazy and want to win with single button presses every now and then. 

~~I also wish stats were not so god damn important or else your skill level means absolutely nothing~~
As someone who hates fighting games, I'd rather not have every match up dictated by skill or a hard counter.

As someone who plays DotA2, it seems normal to me.

> I'd rather not have every match up dictated by skill [...]

Wait, wat? Isn't that what League players constantly ask for alongside strategy?

Allow me to elaborate. In fighting games, even if you have 1 HP, you can still win if you play well despite being behind. If I'm two kills and 30 CS above you, I should be able to stat check you even if you're still 0/0/0 without a significant outplay on your end or a 1v2. Or if I determine you have a better micro than me, I should be able to play back and out macro you. What I'm trying to say is that stat checks should be a thing, but the stat checker needs to be able to fail. If I'm 5/0 on Ahri and miss E and both ends of Q I shouldn't be able to kill you unless you're very behind.

As for hard counters, I am _vehemently_ against them. Champion kits will always have natural counters just due to how many kits there are, but there should never be a time where you should _expect_ to win because you picked a hard counter due to the intensity of the counter. Annie vs Yasuo for example.

Ah, well, since you elaborated it's significantly easier to see your side without erroneous interpretation on my end :) I can be fine with that school of thought. I'm personally not against hard counters, _but_ I tend to play a different game and that game is handled differently and I understand that's not everyone's cup of tea, hence why they play League, or HotS, or whatever they play. 

Thank you for elaborating, I like seeing other people's perspectives :)

let's take a few examples

Riven against old mordekaiser.  Old mordekaiser was a bit toxic but he offered something:  shutting down other toxic top laners and a simple setup for results.  Mordekaiser against riven would be an actual skill matchup because both champions had an equal chance of victory

now compare that to riven against say jayce.  If that riven gets even a single moment of pressure, the jayce will either have to burn flash or die.  In most cases, the jayce will have the advantage of range but riven is never limited by time with nearly instant combos and has multiple forms of hard crowd control to manage her opponent at will

I'll tell you why I hate each of them.
{{champion:67}} Percentile Health True Damage built into her auto-attacks and really no way to locate her once she goes invisible other then by sheer luck. Anit-tank itemization is also really powerful right now, so its hard to build against her.
{{champion:157}} That Windwall and how hard he punishes even the slightest mistake, as well as how hard he scales if ahead.
{{champion:64}} Tower diving and the amount of damage he does is always hard to determine. His kit is so versatile, it gets annoying trying to even partially predict what he'll do next.
{{champion:164}} Feels a bit overloaded, but I don't really have an issue with her other then her ability to heal herself; robot legs equals self-healing? They'll tack sustain onto anything these days.
{{champion:92}} Shield that scales with damage, a ranged cone execute that acts as a damage steroid before use, and its hard to catch her or punish her for mistakes because of all the mobility, all with costs of any kind to cast them. Out of all the champions mentioned, I dislike her possibly the most because she has no mana or other costs to her abilities.

I just don't get people complaining about Riven's shield scaling with AD.

{{champion:131}} {{champion:61}}{{champion:68}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:112}} all scale primarily with AP and nobody seems to care that *their* shields scale with their primary damage stat.

Her stun and mobility I get. The animation cancelling I get. Her having a shield at all I get (but she does pay for it by having garbage health regen).

But if mages can stack AP to increase both their damage and their shields, then I fail to see why Riven can't do the same with AD.
Personally, I think the problem is more the dash on the shield. Since her q already has 3 dashes, being able to dash *again* as well as block damage doing so just seems like too much.
To be fair, it's the equivalent of a "dodge roll" with invulnerability frames, except it trades lasting for more than half a second for not canceling all damage until later on in the game.

I have a problem with nearly every champ on that list, but it's not because they're flashy or popular, it's because of their mechanics and how counterplay goes for them.

{{champion:67}}   her true damage has no counters whatsoever.  If you can't lock her down, you lose.  Period.  Her one weakness outside laning phase is cc, but with qss, her ult, and her q, only champs like Malphite and Gnar can lock her down with huge aoe cc, and that's if they have teammates with more cc to follow up.  Yeah she takes skill and reflexes to play right when she's dodging skills, but unless her enemy has all the right tools to take her down, she wins.
{{champion:157}} I love how flashy he is, and his outplay potential, but his problem is just that.  Basically, you're a boss ath the end of an old videogame.  A bad yas will just run headlong at you and get demolished, but a good yas WILL win.  Powergamers don't lose boss fights, and powergamers play him.  He has all the right tools to win and unless he messes up, he can never die.  Plus once he gets 2 items it doesn't matter how hard you shut him down, he can win the whole game.
{{champion:64}} He doesn't have quite the outplay potential or the skillcap as Yas or Vayne, but his combos are insane.  His full combo (wardhop, e, ult, q,q) has a 380% bonus AD ratio, high base damage, plus it ends with a missing health scaling and plants him in front of you with 40% bonus attack speed.  He builds ad, period.  So many other champs have to give up one thing in their build to have another, but there is no reason not to build straight ad in the early game on Lee.  I just want wardhopping removed so that he has counterplay.  It's outdated and it's bs to play against.
{{champion:92}} Same as lee, but replace wardhopping with animation cancelling.  If she wants to weave in AA's, go ahead, but make her have to take more time to do so.  The skill with Riven should be with reflexes, desisionmaking, and knowing your limits, not pressing buttons really fast.  She's basically a mechanically hard Garen, she should have the same issues he does.  But instead, because of mechanics and no other reason, she gets an incredible skillcap.
{{champion:164}} I don't really hate her, but then again I haven't played much toplane since her release so I don't know her well.  I think her jungle nerfs were unwarranted, she should be balanced with jungle in mind.  I'm glad her ult expires when she dies too, that was broken.

Alright, I know this doesn't apply for vayne, but I think the reason they are all hated is the fact that they have mobility, and the ability to displace/stun up to 5 enemy champions at once. When I say this, I mean the fact that yasuo can get a 5 man tornado, or lee can get a 5 man knock up off kick, camile can displace 5 people at once, and riven has the possibility of stunning multiple people with Q and W.

Of course they do not do this consistently. What I mean is that they are able to move into position with mobility to possibly stun more than one person. I think we can all agree that these champions tend to do damage, so when they are able to both affect multiple champions through cc and do more damage than a juggernaut or tank, they end up feeling extremely toxic to play against, despite the skill it takes to play all of these champions. None of these champs are particularly broken in my opinion. I think we all know how shitty an underfed yasuo is, or how useless a feeding riven is, or camile and vayne for that matter.

Personally I don't really hate any of these champions, I tend to hate champions more like {{champion:105}} or {{champion:1}} who completely change the way you have to play the game by making you play more passive, or champions like {{champion:8}} who are extremely annoying to deal with.

Because when they are played well, they remove the capacity to counterplay them.

Think you can out do riven's combo? Unfortunately she can animation-cancel to deal her damage faster. 

The list goes on & on, but is fundamentally the same; if they're played poorly it shows and it feels like a fair fight, but when they're played well it's nothing but a chain of frustrations. Either by too many safety nets, overloaded mechanics, or denial of player input.

They tend to be either be hand fed their "play-making ability, deal stupid amounts of early game damage, somehow never fall off or behind, or have a mechanic which is unique. But the main reason is that they have a bit of everything, making them hard to deal with.

List of champions whose kits just simply don't fit the direction Riot wants to take LoL in and need WAY more work than the shitty reworks Riot did that made them even worse for the game (Like LB or Ryze). They are either outdated as fuck (extremely binary, huge mana costs, etc) or really interactive and Riot wants to avoid both, or just completely failed gimmicks Riot released.

Due to the nature of duelists they tend to decide the game in champion select with some lee way. However these duelists and some others like Fiora have not only overloaded kits but huge safety nets. If two players of equal skill are facing each other and one of them picks one of these champions, the other has to counter pick them or else they lose. Worse off if you the first player picks a champion that doesn't counter pick them, and the other one of them picks one of those champions, gg. You don't out play them, you can only counter pick them. Possibly with the exception of Lee since he is mostly dependant on his teammates ending the game fast. That and being the jungler is more than counter picking.

The reason is all the safety nets and on top of the denial those safety nets have, this leads to even more hate. Take Camille for instance. Her R makes her untargetable on top of what it does, stops unstoppable forces, knocks opponents away, AND you can't flash out of it. Denial of summoner spells is always considered a cheat regardless of how hard it is to use. Like Fiora's parry for instance, regardless of having to time it perfectly, it cheats because it denies summoner spells. These spells cheat because of ... reasons.

These champions have the tools to especially remove other champions from the game entirely. On top of that the champions removed have harder skill shots to land. Or champions whom sacrificed a lot in their kits for their role, and get replaced by same overloaded champions. Got an UNSTOPPABLE Sion charging at you with basically THE HARDEST SKILL SHOT IN THE GAME TO LAND? It's kay just Camille ult or Fiora parry. Got a Nami ult incoming? from a the support WHOM ARE SUPPOSE TO HAVE NOPE BUTTONS AND PLAYMAKING ABILITIES BECAUSE THEY DO NO DAMAGE. Just windwall it, oh and Yasuo does do damage. Tahm Kench was even hated because he dealt single target damage and had a NOPE button regardless of being a support. You can smell the favouritism.

So that's why these champions are hated. They turn the game into champion select of counter picks. Have tools and safety nets that removes other champions from the game. Same safety net that steal other roles' job and denies them theirs. Are always useful regardless how bad they are because of overloaded kits. Deal undeniable damage on top of what they have in their kits. Seem to draw favouritism from Riot even if Riot may or may not favour them.
